did.unittitle: Indiana University Dean of the Faculties records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Indiana University, Bloomington. Dean of the Faculties Office.

did.abstract: On June 1, 1940, in response to increasing demands upon the President's Office, President Herman B Wells created the position of Dean of Faculties to assume many responsibilities once overseen by the university president. This collection includes records predominantly from the tenure of Ralph C. Collins (1959-1963), Ray L. Heffner, Jr. (1964-1966), Joseph L. Sutton (1966-1968), Joseph R. Hartley (1968-1969), and Henry H. H. Remak (1969-1974) and consists of correspondence, reports, committee files, minutes, and memos.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Advance notice required for access to collection.

Select files closed to researchers. These are indicated in the finding aid. Restricted records are listed in the folder list where they fall intellectually but are physically housed at the end of the collection.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The position of Dean of the Faculties at Indiana was created in May 1940 with the purpose of overseeing the administration of academic affairs at Indiana University. Previously these duties were performed by the President's Office. In creating this office, university president Herman B Wells hoped to redistribute his duties, particularly ones he could not fulfil during his absences, by giving the Dean of the Faculties responsibility for undertaking some of the public appearances, acting on academic problems and proposals, and serving as a member of all university faculty groups. Budget control was the primary responsibility assigned to the Dean of the Faculties, as the Dean controlled all academic budgets and played a key role in the development of annual budgets.

Over the years, the scope of the Office of the Dean of the Faculties expanded to include various aspects of faculty and curriculum administration at Indiana University, such as: evaluation of applications for sabbatical leaves, review of dossiers for promotion and tenure, negotiation of individual grievances, analysis of recommended terms of appointment to assure conformity with university policies, review of all proposals for curricular and degree program changes on the campus, administrating policies affecting associate instructors, and administration of the Patten Foundation and Horizons of Knowledge lectureships.
The following individuals served as Deans of the Faculties of Indiana University and Indiana University, Bloomington, from 1940-1982:

eventgrp.event: Herman T. Briscoe (Vice President and Dean from 1941-on)
Joseph L. Sutton (Vice President and Dean)
Joseph R. Hartley (Vice President and Dean)
Henry H. Remak (Vice Chancellor and Dean)
Frank A. Franz (Dean of the Faculties, Bloomington Campus)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into two series: Administrative Files and Chronological Records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, committee files and minutes, budgets, reports, memoranda, and other materials documenting the Office of the Dean of the Faculties' involvement in almost every facet of the daily operations of the university. Files can be found on virtually every academic program and university service. A few of the more prominent entries include: Academic Handbook, Calendar Committee, Budget, Horizons of Knowledge, Instructional Development Fellowship, Review Committee, Lilly Postdoctoral Teaching Fellowships, Patten Foundation, Research and Graduate Development, student services and programs, and University Division.

The collection also contains various files of administrative policies and procedures concerning faculty members. These files cover such areas as: promotion and tenure, recruitment, sabbatical leaves, retirement, salaries, complaints and grievances, multidisciplinary ventures, affirmative action, review committees, research, etc.

The Office of the Dean of the Faculties also oversees curriculum development and various academic administrations. File topics include: Admissions, Degree Program Proposal Committee, Assistant Instructors, foreign language study committee, grading policies, registration, etc.

The following names are represented in the collection: John Bodnar, Ralph Collins, Frank Franz, William F. Hansen, Hubert C. Heffner, Christoph K. Lohmann, William Lynch, Martha McCarthy, Margaret Jean Peterson, Henry H. Remak, Anya Peterson Royce, Fran Snygg, Susan Stryker, and Stephen L. Wailes.

The Administrative files series (1946-1982) makes up the bulk of the collection and includes files on various administrative units, professional schools, academic departments, and degree programs, as well as files related to specific policies and policy committees and other topics. The series is arranged alphabetically.
The Chronological series (1950-1974) is arranged by year and includes materials sent to and created by the Dean of Faculties between 1950 and 1975.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records such as newsletters, annual reports, bulletins, and publications may be accessed in the Archives of Institutional Memory.
See also Collection C26, Indiana University Vice President and Dean of the Faculties records, 1940-1959.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Dean of the Faculties records, Collection C23, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jessica Ballard and Katie Martin.
